references.paper_title: Neural Tangent Kernel: Convergence and Generalization in Neural Networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the Neural Tangent Kernel (NTK), a key concept for understanding the dynamics of infinitely wide neural networks, which forms the theoretical foundation for much of the work in this paper.

references.paper_title: On the Optimization of Deep Networks: Implicit Acceleration by Overparameterization
references.reason: This paper explores the implicit regularization effect of overparameterization in deep learning, a phenomenon central to the understanding of the lazy and active regimes discussed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: On the Global Convergence of Gradient Descent for Over-parameterized Models using Optimal Transport
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical analysis of gradient descent in overparameterized models, using tools from optimal transport, which are relevant to understanding the training dynamics of linear networks.

references.paper_title: Implicit bias of gradient descent for wide two-layer neural networks trained with the logistic loss
references.reason: This paper investigates the implicit bias of gradient descent in wide two-layer neural networks, providing insights into the phenomenon of feature learning that are relevant to the discussion of active regimes in the current paper.

references.paper_title: A Convergence Analysis of Gradient Descent for Deep Linear Networks
references.reason: This paper provides a detailed convergence analysis of gradient descent for deep linear networks, establishing theoretical results that are directly relevant to the current paper’s focus on linear network dynamics.
